result.execSummary:
The defendant Damian Durrell Payne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $264.00 to Kohls Department Store or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to apply if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly  includes payment with tax intercept.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment or school.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
Complete any and all other counseling deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs or alcohol  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges, and supervision fees.
All court costs, fees, surcharges, restitution to be paid through  collection by DOC from 25% of funds under sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damian Durrell Payne

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Revoked, Sentenced to Prison.  Filed, sdg.

Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest; written reasons attached. /dds

*copy to defendant and district attorney*
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs

Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in custody.  Brad Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of TWO (2) YEARS, with credit for ONE HUNDRED SIXTY-ONE (161) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE (1) YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is ONE (1) YEAR.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school.
* Restitution payable to KOHL'S DEPARTMENT STORE for TWO HUNDRED SIXTY-FOUR DOLLARS ($264.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
(from) Defendant to the Court.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERANS COURT/DTC - PHASE I

Review hearing proceeded.  Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Veterans Treatment Initiative Court Contract.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court, defendant Damian Durrell Payne not in court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERAN COURT/DTC - PHASE I

Defense WAIVES Defendant's appearance for the purposes of this hearing.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERAN COURT/DTC - PHASE I

Review Hearing proceeds. Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Court REMANDED Defendant until the next hearing.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant in Custody.  Court ordered matter adjourned for Return on Warrant.  Return on Warrant calendared for 11-20-2015 at 1:30pm.  sdg
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer for Barbara K Due in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter in Court to address JusticePoint Violation Reports.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERAN COURT/DTC - PHASE I

Review Hearing proceeds. Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 0 (ZERO) points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Drug Treatment Court Veterans Treatment Initiative Court DPA  matter adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Turnover to JusticePoint for placement;  upon placement Bail to revert to $250.00 PR Bond.  sdg

Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERAN COURT/DTC - PHASE I

Court held conference with Counsel and Parties off the Record in open Court.  Review Hearing proceeds.  Court orders matter adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERAN COURT/DTC - PHASE I

Review Hearing proceeds.  State moves to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense reports that Defendant has been incarcerated in Waukesha County since 07-2015 until today.  Court holds colloquy with Defendant.  State was not aware that Defendant was incarcerated in Waukesha County.  Defendant to remain REMANDED pending the next hearing.  Court will adjourn matter for staffing to Br. 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Damian Durrell Payne not in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court previously issued a warrant for the defendant's non-compliance.   Defendant failed to appear for court.   Case remains in warrant status.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court via telephone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

  VETERANS COURT
Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Veterans Treatment Initiative Court Contract.   Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED. FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
Court orders a $1,000.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.

Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and element received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 6/24/2015 at 1:30pm.  lms
( court date in br 37 is cancelled)

Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea. Defendant on waiting listing for Drug Treatment Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Damian Durrell Payne not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Status conference held off the record. Defendant is being considered for Drug Treatment Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court prior in the a.m., defendant Damian Durrell Payne not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel Daniel Meylink is in jury trial in Branch 04 for today's proceedings. Defense counsel is reviewing for possible DPA.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Status conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Damian Durrell Payne not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court via-telephone, defendant Damian Durrell Payne not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for bail-bond hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Bayshore Mall- 5800 North Bayshore Drive; Kohl's Department Store- 5650 N Bayshore Drive. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Damian Durrell Payne in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
